item.title: Lani Danielsâ€™ Unexpected Path to Becoming a World Champion Boxer | Between Two Beers Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Lani Daniels is a World champion boxer who holds the IBF heavyweight title and will this weekend aim to add the Light Heavyweight title to her collection, making her the first Kiwi woman in history to hold two world titles at different weights.Â In this episode we talk about her rollercoaster ride from Pipiwai to world champion, growing up with eight siblings, the tragic loss of her brother and the spiral of drinking, depression and guilt that followed, how she pulled herself out of that hole and discovered boxing, her intense training regime, path to the top and all the best stories in between.

item.title: Awen Guttenbeil: Lessons from my island | Between Two Beers Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description On this episode of Between Two Beers we talk to Awen Gutenbeil.Â You may know Awen as one of New Zealandâ€™s greatest rugby league players, with 170 caps for the Warriors over a professional career that spanned 15 years. The mental and physical challenges of losing mobility, the realities of life without the use of limbs, his sex-life, what it looks like now and why he included so much of it in the book, the darkest thoughts he had â€“ and how he overcame them, and his incredible path to happiness, fulfilment and being present.

item.title: Chelsea Lane: How to make it in the NBA (re-release) | Between Two Beers Podcast

item.title: Ric Salizzo: The Forrest Gump of NZ sport | Between Two Beers Podcast

Then after gaining 20 years of experience in a number of roles, Devoy served as New Zealand race relations commissioner from 2013-2018.

item.title: Kieran Read: The Stuff You Don't See On TV | Between Two Beers Podcast

item.title: Eric Murray: What 'high-performance' really looks like (re-release) | Between Two Beers Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This episode originally aired on Nov 24, 2020. The first thing that struck us about meeting Eric for the first time was his approachability. He had a beer in hand, a huge smile and welcomed us into his home like old friends – excited to share his best stories.  The second was his size. The guy is a giant and when you combine that raw power with an insane aerobic ticker, you can start to understand how he won 8 World Championships, 2 Olympic golds and 69 races undedeated in the Kiwi pair with Hamish Bond.

item.title: Toby Burrows: The king of NZ music festivals | Between Two Beers Podcast

item.description: Podcast Description This episode originally aired on February 1, 2021.
